CRIME: A specific act committed in violation of the law.
FANTASY: That which comes from one's imagination.
ROMANCE: A story relating to chivalry; a story involving knights, heroes, adventures, quests, etc.
WESTERN: A film, or some other dramatic work, set in, the historic (c. 1850-1910) American West (west of the Mississippi river) focusing on conflict between whites and Indians, lawmen and outlaws, ranchers and farmers, or industry (railroads, mining) and agriculture.
